member.summary: Gets or sets a flag specifying if a Save should also load new values that happened in between.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.IO.Store`1.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Waits for pending operation to finish, if any. Note that it does not write pending transaction if has not been called before.

member.summary: Reads the variable length int. Work with assumption that value is in the stream and throws exception if it isn't. If you want to check if value is in the stream use instead.
member.returns: The value.

member.summary: Reads the block of bytes. Contrary to does not read partial data if possible. If there is no data (yet) it waits.
member.returns: Number of bytes read.

member.summary: Writes the variable length integer.

member.summary: Flushes current chunk.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.AcquireNextChunk
member.summary: Reads the next chunk from stream.
member.returns: true if next has been read, or false if it is legitimate end of file. Throws if end of stream was unexpected.

member.name: P:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.CanRead
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.CanSeek
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.returns: true if the stream supports seeking; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.CanWrite
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.returns: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: P:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Length
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in bytes of the stream.
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

member.name: P:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Position
member.summary: The position in the uncompressed stream.
member.returns: The current position within the stream.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Reset
member.summary: Reset the stream to its initial position and state

member.name: M:Stride.Core.LZ4.LZ4Stream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Stride.Core.Serialization.AttachedReference
member.summary: Stores the object reference information, so that it is easy to work on partially loaded or CPU version of assets with .

member.summary: The asset URL of the referenced data.

member.name: F:Stride.Core.Serialization.AttachedReference.Id
member.summary: The asset unique identifier.

member.name: F:Stride.Core.Serialization.AttachedReference.IsProxy
member.summary: If yes, this object won't be recursively saved in a separate chunk by . Use this if you only care about the Url reference.

member.name: F:Stride.Core.Serialization.AttachedReference.Data
member.summary: Data representation (useful if your object is a GPU object but you want to manipulate a CPU version of it). This needs to be manually interpreted by a custom implementation.

member.exception: reference

member.name: M:Stride.Core.Serialization.Contents.ContentManager.Reload(System.Object,System.String,Stride.Core.Serialization.Contents.ContentManagerLoaderSettings)
member.summary: Reloads a content. If possible, same recursively referenced objects are reused.
member.param: The url of the new object to load. This allows to replace an asset by another one, or to handle renamed content.
member.returns: True if it could be reloaded, false otherwise.
member.exception: Content not loaded through this ContentManager.

member.name: M:Stride.Core.Serialization.Contents.ContentManager.ReloadAsync(System.Object,System.String,Stride.Core.Serialization.Contents.ContentManagerLoaderSettings)
member.summary: Reloads a content asynchronously. If possible, same recursively referenced objects are reused.

member.returns: A task that completes when the content has been reloaded. The result of the task is True if it could be reloaded, false otherwise.
member.exception: Content not loaded through this ContentManager.

member.summary: Loads an asset from the specified URL asynchronously.

member.remarks: If the asset is already loaded, it just increases the reference count of the asset and return the same instance.
member.returns: The loaded content.

member.summary: Loads an asset from the specified URL asynchronously.

member.returns: The loaded content.

member.name: T:Stride.StrideVersion
member.summary: Internal version used to identify Stride version.
member.remarks: During package build, PackageUpdateVersionTask is updating that file and expect some specific text regex so be careful if you change any of this.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.PublicVersion
member.summary: The version used by editor for display purpose. 4th digit needs to be at least 1 if used (due to NuGet special cases).

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: The current assembly version as text, currently same as .

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSimple
member.summary: The NuGet package version without special tags.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersion
member.summary: The NuGet package version.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSuffix
member.summary: The NuGet package suffix (i.e. -beta01). Automatically set by Stride.GitVersioning.GenerateVersionFile. Three possible values: - Empty: official release - -betaXX: development version (XX should corespond to development asset versioning) - -betaXX-YYYY: beta release (YYYY is the git height since current version has been bumped)

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.BuildMetadata
member.summary: The build metadata, usually +g[git_hash] during package. Automatically set by Stride.GitVersioning.GenerateVersionFile.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyInformationalVersion
member.summary: The informational assembly version, containing -beta01 or +g[git_hash] during package.

member.name: T:Stride.PublicKeys
member.summary: Assembly signing information.

member.name: F:Stride.PublicKeys.Default
member.summary: Assembly name suffix that contains signing information.
